com.swoval.files

Interface QuickFile


  • public interface QuickFile
    Represents a file that will be returned by QuickList.list(java.nio.file.Path, int). Provides fast isDirectory() and isFile() methods that should not call stat (or the non-POSIX equivalent) on the * underlying file. Can be converted to a File or Path with toFile() and toPath().

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      com.swoval.files.FileWithFileType asFile()
      Returns an instance of FileWithFileType.
      java.lang.String getFileName()
      Returns the fully resolved file name
      boolean isDirectory()
      Returns true if this was a directory at the time time of listing.
      boolean isFile()
      Returns true if this was a regular file at the time time of listing.
      boolean isSymbolicLink()
      Returns true if this was a symbolic link at the time time of listing.
      java.io.File toFile()
      Returns an instance of File.
      java.nio.file.Path toPath()
      Returns an instance of Path.

    • Method Detail

      • getFileName

        java.lang.String getFileName()
        Returns the fully resolved file name
        Returns:
        the fully resolved file name

      • isDirectory

        boolean isDirectory()
        Returns true if this was a directory at the time time of listing. This may become inconsistent if the QuickFile is cached
        Returns:
        true when the QuickFile is a directory

      • isFile

        boolean isFile()
        Returns true if this was a regular file at the time time of listing. This may become inconsistent if the QuickFile is cached
        Returns:
        true when the QuickFile is a file

      • isSymbolicLink

        boolean isSymbolicLink()
        Returns true if this was a symbolic link at the time time of listing. This may become inconsistent if the QuickFile is cached
        Returns:
        true when the QuickFile is a symbolic link

      • asFile

        com.swoval.files.FileWithFileType asFile()
        Returns an instance of FileWithFileType. Typically the implementation of QuickFile while extend FileWithFileType. This method will then just cast the instance to File. Because the isDirectory() and isFile() methods will generally cache the value of the native file result returned by readdir (posix) or FindNextFile (windows) and use this value to compute isDirectory() and isFile(), the returned FileWithFileType is generally unsuitable to be used as a persistent value. Instead, use toFile().
        Returns:
        An instance of FileWithFileType. This may just be a cast.

      • toFile

        java.io.File toFile()
        Returns an instance of File. The instance should not override File.isDirectory() or File.isFile() which makes it safe to persist.
        Returns:
        an instance of File

      • toPath

        java.nio.file.Path toPath()
        Returns an instance of Path.
        Returns:
        an instance of Path
